skill.name: pydanticai-docs
skill.description: Use this skill for requests related to Pydantic AI framework - building agents, tools, dependencies, structured outputs, and model integrations.
skill.summary: Use this skill for requests related to Pydantic AI framework - building agents, tools, dependencies,...
skill.author: DougTrajano

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external commands are present. The skill provides documentation and guidance for using the Pydantic AI framework.

content.user_title: Build AI agents with Pydantic AI guidance
content.value_statement: Building production-grade AI agents requires understanding type safety, dependency injection, and structured outputs. This skill provides comprehensive documentation and examples for the Pydantic AI Python framework.
actual_capabilities: Provide documentation for Pydantic AI agents and tools
Explain dependency injection patterns for AI applications
Show structured output examples using Pydantic models
Guide on using toolsets and model integrations
Offer best practices for production AI applications
limitations: Does not execute code or install packages
Does not access local files or repositories
Does not make network requests to external APIs
Provides guidance only, no direct integration with user projects

use_cases.title: Build type-safe AI agents
use_cases.description: Create production-ready AI agents with proper type hints, dependency injection, and validated structured outputs.

use_cases.title: Design agent architectures
use_cases.description: Learn patterns for organizing tools, dependencies, and model integrations in scalable AI applications.

use_cases.title: Implement structured outputs
use_cases.description: Use Pydantic models to ensure LLM responses conform to specific schemas and data types.

prompt_templates.title: Basic agent setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating your first Pydantic AI agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a basic Pydantic AI agent with OpenAI and run a simple query.

prompt_templates.title: Add tools to agents
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I add custom tools to a Pydantic AI agent? Show me an example with @agent.tool decorator.

prompt_templates.title: Structured outputs
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use Pydantic models to get structured, type-safe output from my agent? Give me a complete example.

prompt_templates.title: Dependency injection
prompt_templates.scenario: Managing external services and API keys
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to use dependency injection in Pydantic AI. How do I pass API keys and database connections to my tools?

output_examples.input: How do I create an agent that returns structured city information?
output: Define a Pydantic BaseModel with your desired fields (name, country, population)
Create an Agent with output_type set to your model class
Run the agent with your query - it will return validated, typed output
Access the structured data via result.output which is an instance of your model

best_practices: Always define deps_type and output_type for better IDE support and type safety
Use dependency injection for database connections, API clients, and other shared services
Use Pydantic models for all structured outputs to ensure validated, type-safe responses
anti_patterns: Avoid using plain dictionaries instead of Pydantic models for outputs
Do not hardcode API keys in agent code - use dependency injection
Avoid creating agents without proper type definitions for dependencies and outputs

faq.question: Which LLM providers are supported by Pydantic AI?
faq.answer: Pydantic AI supports any model provider with tool-calling capability including OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, and Ollama.

faq.question: What Python version is required?
faq.answer: Pydantic AI requires Python 3.9 or higher. Check your Python version with python --version before installation.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill is compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Install via pip and import the Agent class.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation guidance. No data is sent to external services or stored anywhere.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication in my agents?
faq.answer: Use the deps_type parameter to define a dependency class. Inject API keys through the deps argument when running agents.

faq.question: How is Pydantic AI different from LangChain?
faq.answer: Pydantic AI focuses on type safety and structured outputs using Pydantic models. It provides a simpler, more Pythonic API for building agents.
